name: Daniel H. Huson
content: Daniel Huson | Universität Tübingen Office C310a, Sand 14, 72076 Tübingen  +49-7071-29-70450 daniel.husonspam prevention@uni-tuebingen.de Publications Google Scholar Office hours Mondays, 17-18h (by email appointment) Bungy 1, 2, 3 2020-22 International Leader Fellowship Royal Society of New Zealand 2015-2020 Visiting Professor Life Sciences Institute of the National University of Singapore 2011-2015 Visiting Professor SCELSE and School of Biological Sciences, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore Since 2002 Professor of Algorithms in Bioinformatics University of Tübingen 1999-02 Senior staff scientist Celera Genomics in Rockville, MD 1997-99 Post-doc in Applied Mathematics and Bioinformatics Princeton University and the University of Pennsylvania 1997 Habilitation in Mathematics at Bielefeld University 1994-96 DFG "Habilitation" scholarship 1993-97 Various visiting positions University of Canterbury and Massey University in New Zealand 1990-94 Various scientific positions Bielefeld University 1990 PhD in Mathematics Bielefeld University (Dr. math., summa cum laude) 1988-89 Visiting student University of Washington, Seattle USA 1980-86 Studied mathematics and physics Bielefeld University (Diploma, magna cum laude) 1971-80 Hauptschule and Gesamtschule Bielefeld, Germany ("Abitur", best student of year) Senior staff scientist at Celera Genomics in Rockville, MD Various scientific positions at Bielefeld University PhD in Mathematics, Bielefeld University (Dr. math., summa cum laude) Hauptschule and Gesamtschule in Bielefeld, Germany ("Abitur", best student of year) 2019-23 Royal Society of New Zealand International Leader Catalyst Fellowship 2017 PLOS Computational Biology Research Prize Winner 2016 Technology Transfer Prize of the IHK Reutlingen 2013 Winner of the 2013 DTRA Algorithms Challenge 2007 Visiting Fellow of the Newton Institute (Cambridge University) 2006 Visiting Erskine Professor at the University of Canterbury, Christchurch New Zealand 1990 Dissertation Prize of the westfälisch-lippische Universitätsgesellschaft 2006-Current Program committee member of many different conferences, including GCB, RECOMB, WABI, AFBC, ISMB, RECOMG-CG Since 2012 Member of the board of QBIC Since 2012 Founding member of the board of Computomics 2011-2021 Member of Scientific Advisory Board of CeGaT Since 2011 Faculty member of the International Max-Plank Research School (IMPRS) "From Molecules to Organisms" 2011-2014 Head of Department, Computer Science Department, University of Tübingen 2010-2014 Scientific Advisory Board of the Allan Wilson Centre for Molecular Ecology and Evolution 2004-2008 Scientific Advisory Board of the MPI for Developmental Biology 2007 Co-organizer Phylogenetics, Newton Institute, Cambridge, 2003-2008 Dean of Studies, Computer Science Department, University of Tübingen
